title: KCS Intern
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. KKR & Co. L.P. (KKR) is a leading global investment firm with deep roots in private equity, diversified capabilities, and an impressive track record. When you partner with KKR, you benefit from decades of financial and operational experience, broad industry knowledge, and a powerful network of global relationships. Through an integrated approach, we work closely with companies and investment partners around the world to deliver flexible capital solutions. The power of partnership with KKR means we strive for better investments, stronger businesses, and shared success.
With offices around the world, we fulfill our mission one investor at a time, one company at a time—and we do this as one global firm. As investors with an industrialist vision, we think long-term, pursue the highest standards of excellence, and align our interests with those of all our investment partners by putting our own capital behind our ideas.
More information can be found at www.kkr.com
POSITION SUMMARY
The Global Client Solutions (KCS) team is looking for an intern to support the DACH team (as primary focus) and also potentially support the broader EMEA Institutional and Family Capital teams. This role will report to the Head of KCS DACH. This role will be based in Frankfurt, Germany.
You will have the opportunity to experience working within a leading global investment firm that manages investments across multiple alternative asset classes with a proven track record over the past few decades. The role would be to support the KCS team, which is responsible for marketing various KKR-sponsored investment funds, vehicles and separate accounts to investors.
Start: Beginning of May 2024 at the latest
IDEAL EXPERIENCE
A successful candidate typically will have 2-3 previous internships in the financial industry
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Providing ongoing support to KCS in connection with its response to ad-hoc requests from clients to ensure high servicing standards are maintained at all times


Learn the platform, products and investment strategies across asset classes


Work collaboratively with global internal teams – specifically: product teams, client services, RFP team, and other institutional sales members to facilitate timely responses to client requests


Assist to coordinate/prepare sales, product pitching, client meeting materials (with direction of DACH coverage KCS lead)


Assist in preparing for external marketing events, and assist preparation of responses to client data requests/RFPs, including underlying portfolio stats, marketing materials and presentation decks


Maintain information on the DACH budgets and pipeline and provide internal weekly updates on the status of each of these clients / prospects


Provide support to the broader sales team in terms of responding to ad-hoc requests from clients


in other regions; liaise with the other sales support team to ensure weekly internal reporting of pipeline


As with any growing, changing and evolving team, this individual will be expected to remain flexible and help support other key team initiatives.


CRITICAL COMPETENCIES FOR SUCCESS


Excellent communication skills (written and spoken) with fluency in German and English


Strong academic credentials & record of achievement


Strong multi-tasking skills with an ability to effectively communicate with both internal and external parties in a polished, professional manner


Demonstrated team player willing to contribute to the collaborative success of the broader team


Ability to foster strong working relationships with fellow team members


Keen interest in global financial markets and alternative investments


Attention to detail, highly organized, and commitment to excellence


Self-motivated and proactive with the ability to prioritize


Strong cultural awareness and sensitivity to operate in a regional role with team interactions across the globe
